alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 29 at 6:35PM EDT until May 29 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 633 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to nearly stationary thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen from earlier thunderstorms this afternoon. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a flash flood warning may be needed for this area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include...Hollywood, Miami Beach, Surfside, Hallandale, North Miami, North Miami Beach, Aventura, Dania Beach, Sunny Isles Beach, Miami Shores, North Bay Village, El Portal, Ojus, Golden Glades, Port Of Miami, Downtown Miami, Pembroke Park, Bay Harbor Islands and Biscayne Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
